Curiosities.text: In Mexico, the term Tara is sometimes used in agricultural and market settings to refer to the standard crates or containers used for transporting and selling produce.
Tara more commonly refers to the weight of the empty container (We refer to the Tara with the expectation of filling it for you.);
The actual Tara (crates) used for vegetables are often called cajas (boxes), huacales (wooden crates), or rejas (plastic crates).
Tara is the way that farmers and vendors at supply centers (like Central de Abasto) use these to store and move their goods efficiently.
